contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Protected Area | name = Brockman National Park | iucn_category = II | nearest_city = [[Pemberton, Western Australia|Pemberton]] | map = Western Australia | region = AU-WA | lat_d = 34 | lat_m = 30 | lat_s = 52 | lat_NS = S | long_d = 115 | long_m = 59 | long_s = 46 | long_EW = E | area = {{convert|52|ha|abbr=on}}<ref name="ParkAreas">{{cite journal| year=2010| title=Department of Environment and Conservation 2009â€“2010 Annual Report|pages=48|publisher = Department of Environment and Conservation| issn = 1835-114X| url = http://www.dec.wa.gov.au/content/view/6139/2345/}}</ref> | established = 1977 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | governing_body = [[Department of Environment and Conservation (Western Australia)|Department of Environment and Conservation]] | url = http://www.dec.wa.gov.au/component/option,com_hotproperty/task,view/id,123/Itemid,1584/ }} '''Brockman National Park''' is a national park in the [[South West (Western Australia)|South West region]] of [[Western Australia]] ([[Australia]]), {{convert|288|km}} south of [[Perth, Western Australia|Perth]] and {{convert|10|km|abbr=on}} south of [[Pemberton, Western Australia|Pemberton]]. The park, situated on both sides if the Pemberton-Northcliffe road, is predominantly composed of [[Eucalyptus diversicolor|Karri]] and [[Corymbia calophylla|Marri]] Forest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dec.wa.gov.au/component/option,com_hotproperty/task,view/id,123/Itemid,1584/|title=Department of Environment and Conservation - Park Finder|year=2008|accessdate=1 May 2010}}</ref> The forest understorey is made up of a mix of plants including [[Agonis|swamp peppermint]], [[Trymalium|karri hazel]], [[Acacia|karri wattle]] and [[Sheoak|karri sheoak]] all of which thrive in the damp conditions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wildlife-tours.tourtravelworld.com/national-parks/brockman-national-park.htm|title=Tour Tavel World - Brockman National Park|year=2007|accessdate=1 May 2010}}</ref> The northern border of the park is the [[Warren River (Western Australia)|Warren River]] and the [[Warren National Park]] borders it to the west. No entry fee applies for the park and no facilities are available to visitors. The name is taken from the nearby [[Yeagarup Homestead]] that used to be known as Brockman Station.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.totaltravel.com.au/travel/wa/southwestwa/southernforest/travel-guides/gardens/brockman-national-park|title=Total Travel -Brockman National Park|year=2008|accessdate=1 May 2010}}</ref> ==See also== * [[Protected areas of Western Australia]] == References == {{reflist}} {{National Parks of Western Australia}} [[Category:National parks of Western Australia]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1977]] {{WesternAustralia-geo-stub}}
